Title: Save Our Church, Save Our Community Outreach!
Location: London, Greater London, United Kingdom
Organization: RCCG - THE NEW CREATION ASSEMBLY FOR ALL NATIONS
OrganizationDetails: Registered nonprofitDonations eligible for Gift Aid.
Description: Save Our Church  Save our Community!    The R.C.C.G New Creation Assembly in South Norwood  London is seeking your support and assistance with a donation of funds towards the purchase of our current Sanctuary.     We have been a part of South Norwood and its environs since 2012 and have always taken advantage of any opportunity to give back to our community  because we believe that we have been blessed to bless others.     To the glory of God  the Church has increased in number but our present place of worship is now being offered for sale by the current owners. Your support will ensure that we purchase this property for the body of Christ  so it doesn't slip into the hands of developers who are likely to convert to residential dwellings.     We are a family church and believe so much that our community should have a place of worship and also keep enjoying the fellowship that we provide;  Our church currently serves food and hot drinks to families and charities around the South Norwood and Croydon area through our Food-bank Ministry and we are also a part of the Croydon Street Champions  offering a quarterly cleaning to the community of South Norwood.    We aim to raise 150 000 pounds by the end of 2020 and we will like to seek the help of everyone to achieve this goal.    God bless as you donate    Our church website : www.rccgnewcreation.com

Title: We Care Community Kitchen Fund
Location: London, Greater London, United Kingdom
Description: The award-winning We Care Community Hub at Kath's Place Deptford  which includes a food bank  a food pantry  and an advice and support centre  needs to raise money to expand our work and enable us to satisfy an ever-increasing demand for our services from desperate people. We made a short film about our work during the first lockdown  which has won many awards now in international film festivals. You can watch this short film here:    Feeding Lewisham    We really hope that our work will inspire YOU to donate NOW  and also to copy what we are doing here in Deptford in your local community.    We want to turn our unusable basement (which presently is just a bare) shell into a multi-functional community kitchen that will be able to feed anyone in crisis (no matter what their faith  gender  sexuality  or legal or economic status). We want to provide a place where people who love to cook  but who are unable to do so because of their housing situation  can enjoy cooking healthy balanced meals for themselves and others  which our volunteers can deliver to our clients who are in crisis  many of whom have very specific dietary requirements. Any surplus food will be sold in our community cafe to help fund our work.    The work of the We Care project at Kath's Place Deptford will be featured on ITV flagship current affairs programme London Tonight   7.30pm Thursday 11 February 2021 title ' on the breadline-Food Bank Britain ( Food Bank Britain is also the Title of Ray Woolford explosive book and Guide ).     Your donation will help us to create a not-for-profit community food hub model that any community in crisis and without funding or support from the government or local authorities could copy. We also hope that this kitchen will become a platform for generating new solutions to support people into work during the pandemic and beyond.    You could set up a small monthly payment to We Care Cooperative account Lewisham   Sort code 08-92-99 Account number 65659328

Title: Auchtermuchty Angels
Location: Auchtermuchty, Scotland, United Kingdom
Description: The Auchtermuchty Angels are a community group that started at the beginning of COVID-19 Pandemic lockdown. We are non-profit group and all funds raised will go directly back into the community.    Our main aim is to support the local community with different projects that we will adapt to the current challenges faced. However  our main focus will always be the local food-bank  which is located in the community centre and making sure that we are able to sustain it to a level that will allow us to support families in the community when they need it most     As always running a community group requires funding and we have been so lucky that due to the generosity of local businesses and people that we have been able to sustain what we started back in March 2020 and we want to be in a position to continue offering support for as long as it is needed.     Therefore we have set up this fundraising page to support all our activities and again would be entirely grateful for any donations received     Stay Safe

Title: Miles for Meals
Location: Mortimer Common, South East England, United Kingdom
Description: Hi I’m Tristan. I am 14 and I am looking to give back to my local community via the Food Bank.     Lockdown saw many people struggle and find themselves in need of help. One of the many charities who gave support through lockdown were the Food Banks.   From April 2019- March 2020  1.9 million food parcels were given to people in need.   From April 2020- September 2020 that number had already been beaten  with 1 239 399 emergency food parcels given.   (Statistics from the Trussell Trust website.)    The Trussell Trust are a charity who strive to ‘stop UK hunger’. They support a nationwide network of food banks and provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty. They also campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK.   There are various ways of helping the food banks  from donating food  volunteering your time  direct donations or fundraising like me. If you would like to donate to the Trussell Trust directly  please visit their website at trusselltrust.org     I would like to give directly to my local food bank as they have given help and support to my own family when we have needed it.     Over the Easter Holidays I began to walk  run and jog a planned course to the top of Mount Everest. Unfortunately I wasn’t able to climb the real Mount Everest! But with the help of an app called The Conqueror  I was able to follow the 40 mile route that is usually taken by hikers  and map my progress. I added updates that detail the journey and there’s plenty of photos to check out. The app that I am using also plants a tree on my behalf every time I reach the next 20% marker  which means that you and I are not only helping the local Food Bank  but also our planet.     The profits raised after my challenge were spent purchasing items that the food bank can use to build food packages for families in my area. I used a local supermarket to get the best possible prices and actually shopped myself! Yes who knew that a 14 year old boy would voluntarily go food shopping!   Along the way I also learnt about period poverty in low income families  so I also brought sanitary products as the food bank also distribute toiletries.     This challenge was so successful  so I will continue to do these challenges and raise as much money as I can in aid of the food bank. Many people still rely on a weekly food parcel and therefore food banks will continue to need our support. I have so far completed the Mount Everest and Giza Pyramids challenges and my next virtual journey is going to be Mount Fuji. There is loads of information and photos about each trek on the updates tab so please check them out.     If you would like to donate to my cause  I would be very grateful.    I was looking online for a quote to finish off with and found one I liked by Helen Keller....    “Alone  we can do so little;   Together  we can do so much. “

Title: Lighthouse Building Project
Location: Aylesford, South East England, United Kingdom
OrganizationDetails: Registered nonprofitDonations eligible for Gift Aid.
Description: For the past 17 years  Lighthouse Maidstone  a charity registered in England and Wales  has been serving the Maidstone Community through our various charitable activities  including  to name a few  our weekly Soup Kitchen for the Homeless Community  Christmas Hamper Project  Children’s Activities including Halloween and Christmas Parties and our Monthly Women’s Networking Meetings  bringing together women of all ages and walks of life    There is a lot more we can do and want to do  but we are severely limited by space. For instance  until a few years ago  we also ran a Food-Bank and Holiday Club but have had to suspend both due to lack of space to run them. We however continue to regularly receive enquiries from the Community for these services and it is heartbreaking to turn people in need away    Together We Can All Make A Difference  An opportunity has presented itself for us to acquire a building  which will serve as a base for our charitable works. Acquiring this building will not only enable us to resume some of the services we have been forced to put on hold but also to introduce additional services for the benefit of our community. Please click here to see our Newsletter with further details of our current charitable works and what is proposed for the future.    We believe that with everyone doing their little bit  we can make a real difference in our community and we are inviting you to come alongside us to help make this happen.     Here's How You Can Help  We are looking to raise £150 000 towards acquiring a building  which will enable us to not only resume some of the services we have had to put on hold but even do more to serve our community. Please partner with us in changing lives by giving what you can towards the purchase of the building.

Title: Food & clothes bank: elderly, homeless, in need
Location: London, Greater London, United Kingdom
Description: Agape Ministry - part of the Willesden New Testament Church of God which is a registered Charity. Your donations will go towards our Brent community food bank for the homeless  those in need for whatever reason  and the elderly in the community especially during the pandemic. Members from our community attend every Wednesday between 6.30-7.30pm at The Lewinson Centre 165-167 High Road Willesden NW10 (opposite Savers) and benefit from getting  free of charge  a whole range of food  and other items like toiletries and clothes if available. How We Began On the 1st April 2020 the Agape Ministry Food Bank was birthed we were responding to the obviously need in our Community in Brent caused by this dreadful Coronavirus pandemic. There were three volunteer workers: Amie Alexis  Sis Madge Facey and myself  Felicia Alexis. We had one box  which was by no means full  and a desire to minister to the church and the community. That day we distributed 9 bags.   In the weeks that followed we have seen God move in an amazing way. Members and friends of the Church rose to the challenge  they donated money on-line and donated food items to the Ministry over and over again. I have to pause here to say ‘thank you’ for your generosity. Heaven knows how many people you have impacted in a positive way. I would like to acknowledge not only those who have given  but to those who have prayed or volunteered their time in anyway as well. We are workers together with God and we are all doing our bit.   Some people will bring in one or two items some  several bags full. Nothing is too small or too big  all is received gratefully. From time to time we will receive surprise donations from the local butchers  restaurants  green grocers and even a school. Now we are into a new year still facing the pandemic and we are ministering to more and more people in the community. We see people every week from all different nationalities. Besides offering food we provide a safe place where people can come and feel the presence of God and find hope in a hopeless world. No one is rejected  everyone is accepted. Every week we provide tea  coffee  biscuits and cake for those coming in. Besides food  people are now looking for nappies  washing powder  readymade meals and even a vacuum cleaner. Our Faithful Volunteers I would like to mention the faithful volunteers that work with  me week after week. Sis Madge Facey  Sis Janet Ashman  Sis Fay Scott and my faithful husband Joseph Alexis. Bro Anthony Manning who sets a worshipful atmosphere with live music and Bro David Oram who comes every other week with his Healing banner and offers prayers for anyone who asks. I also would like to mention Bro Tim Stewart  who gets roped into helping me anytime he turns up and Sis Denice Denton who is there whenever she can be. We also have a young lady who lives in the community who has recently volunteered some of her time  to helping us with the ministry.   As we begin 2021 we will be inviting business people to partner with us by donating £100.00 for one month. In return the team will pray faithfully for the success of that business for the whole of that month and we will promote it. Joseph Alexis is the first ‘volunteer’ and his business is called Sixela Ltd  he provides a handyman services. He can be contacted on Telephone No. 07[phone redacted]93.   The Agape Ministry is growing and we are expecting to see increase this year both in numbers and in our sphere of influence. May God bless you all as we use every opportunity that we have to let our light shine before men that they may see our good works and come to glorify our Father who is in heaven.   Felicia Alexis - Agape Ministry Leader

Title: Rufus Please!
Location: Rhyl, Wales, United Kingdom
OrganizationDetails: Registered nonprofitDonations eligible for Gift Aid.
Description: Rufus please!       As a Christian place of worship  Sussex Street Christian Centre (formerly Sussex Street Baptist Church) has been in the centre of Rhyl since 1863  when the English Baptist church was built for the English speaking people coming into Wales to work  and who wanted a place to worship God. We are a bilingual Church.    The building is beautiful  is Grade 2 listed  meaning all work must be approved and overseen by CADW.  Regeneration is also coming to Sussex Street generally  with the demolition and refurbishment of the Queen’s Market.    As with other organisations in Rhyl  and UK generally  our congregation is heavily involved in Food Bank and Fare Share. Up to end September 2020 we had helped nearly 5000 people in these ways  in 1 year. Coronavirus has made us extremely busy; however  we enjoy helping our local community  and ensure our clients are in touch with an agency who can help them.    In the past 157 years  we have served the community in many and varied ways.    In the early 1900s afternoon teas  for ladies and gentlemen  were served  on different days.    We have sought to take a great interest in the young people of our town  holding Venturers and Boys Brigade meetings  plus girl Guides and Brownie groups in the past.   As well as mixed meetings we have groups for ladies  men  and children  so that all feel included. In fact  children between ages 4 and 18 receive Christian teaching in a fun  challenging  but empowering way.     As needs have changed in our community  members of our congregation have been involved in our local schools doing after school Club meetings  also taking some morning assemblies at the Headteacher’s request. This is a UK – wide venture  Open the Book  which many children and teachers have said they value because it helps them.     As stated  our building is 157 years old and the upkeep of it can be  and is  a big strain on our resources. When we discovered our roof needed urgent attention with Welsh slate tiles having to be used  we came up with the idea of crowd funding. The amount we are hoping to raise over the next year is approx. £30 000 to £40 000. There are 3 separate roof areas needing attention; ideally all should be repaired and replaced. The sum for this is in excess of £100 000. We are currently fundraising; work is soon to start on the front. The remaining works can only be started as fundraising progresses.  Our Charity  Sussex Street Christian Centre is a Charity Incorporated Organisation (CIO)  so we are an independent charity.    To assist us yet further to serve the community  we have completely modernised our kitchen to provide lunches. One of our current aims is to provide lunches to those in need in Rhyl. The toilet area is now refurbished and is suitable for friends needing access with wheelchairs.     Our Minister is the Rev Trevor Casey and we have a board of Trustees who deal with the oversight and running of the Church building.  The age range of our congregation is 4yrs to 96 years.     There is an old Church in Rhyl    whose roof is no longer sealed   the seagulls there nested    bad weather regressed it   now old beams must make an appeal    From Diana  a Church member    https://www.christiancentre.info/    We need your help now please!
